title: The Whirlpool of Thrive Model
description: The Whirlpool of Thrive is a holistic model of wellbeing that recognises the interconnected layers of our existence, from our core to our environmental context and back again.

layers.name: Spirit
layers.description: The core of your whirlpool - your spiritual essence, connection to peace, purpose, meaning, and values.
prompts: What gives your life meaning and purpose?
What values are most important to you?
How do you connect with something larger than yourself?
When are you most at peace?
reflectionPrompts: When do you feel most connected to your sense of purpose?
How might you align your daily actions more closely with your core values?
What practices help you connect with your spiritual dimension?
flowStates: Sense of connection to something greater

layers.name: Energy
layers.description: Your life force and vitality - the energy that animates and sustains you through each day.
prompts: How is your overall energy level?
How do you feel when you wake up in the morning?
What activities energise you?
What drains your energy?
reflectionPrompts: When do you feel most energised and alive?
How might you structure your day to honour your natural energy rhythms?
What practices help you restore your energy when depleted?
blockageIndications: Feeling drained by activities that once energised you
flowStates: Natural rhythms of activity and rest

layers.name: Genetics
layers.description: Your biological inheritance that shapes your predispositions, tendencies, and unique traits.
prompts: What inherited traits do you recognize in yourself?
How do your genetic predispositions influence your wellbeing?
What family patterns have you observed across generations?
How do you work with your biological tendencies?
reflectionPrompts: When do you feel most at peace with your inherited traits?
How might you honor your genetic inheritance while creating your own path?
What genetic strengths can you build upon for greater wellbeing?
flowStates: Working with rather than against biology

layers.name: Mind
layers.description: Your thoughts, emotions, beliefs, and mental patterns that shape your experience.
prompts: What thought patterns do you notice?
How do you relate to difficult emotions?
What beliefs shape your view of yourself and the world?
reflectionPrompts: When do you experience mental clarity and peace?
How might you respond to challenging thoughts with greater compassion?
What beliefs serve your wellbeing, and which might be limiting you?

layers.name: Nervous System
layers.description: Your body's stress response and regulation system that influences how you respond to life.
prompts: How does your body respond to stress?
What helps you feel calm and centered?
How do you recover after challenging experiences?
reflectionPrompts: When does your nervous system feel most settled and regulated?
How might you recognize early signs of dysregulation?
What practices help you return to a state of calm after activation?
blockageIndications: Difficulty returning to baseline after stress

layers.name: Body
layers.description: Your physical health, movement, rest, and sensory experience of the world.
prompts: How do you care for your physical health?
What is your relationship with movement and rest?
How do you experience the world through your senses?
reflectionPrompts: When does your body feel most alive and well?
How might you honor your body's needs more fully?
What sensory experiences bring you joy and grounding?

layers.name: Relationships
layers.description: Your connections with others - family, friends, partners, and colleagues.
prompts: What are your most important relationships?
How do you give and receive support?
What patterns do you notice in your relationships?
reflectionPrompts: When do you feel most connected and understood by others?
How might you cultivate more authentic relationships?
What boundaries would support healthier connections?

layers.name: Community
layers.description: Your belonging to groups, communities, and collective identities.
prompts: What communities are you part of?
How do you contribute to your communities?
Where do you feel a sense of belonging?
reflectionPrompts: When do you experience a genuine sense of belonging?
How might your gifts and talents serve your community?
What communities align with your values and aspirations?

layers.name: Environment
layers.description: Your physical surroundings, access to nature, and the broader ecology you're part of.
prompts: How does your environment affect your wellbeing?
What is your connection to the natural world?
How do you shape and respond to your surroundings?
reflectionPrompts: When do your surroundings most support your wellbeing?
How might you create spaces that nourish rather than deplete you?
What forms of connection with nature restore your sense of balance?

modelConcepts.flow: The natural movement of energy, resources, and information between layers when blockages are removed.
modelConcepts.blockage: Restriction or inhibition that prevents smooth flow between layers, often manifesting as distress or dysfunction.
modelConcepts.resonance: How changes in one layer naturally affect and influence other layers, creating ripple effects throughout the whirlpool.
modelConcepts.integration: The harmony that emerges when all layers are acknowledged and supported in their unique functions and interconnections.
